send.title: Send payment

info.none: No memo. Use this when the recipient is not expecting a memo.
info.text: Free text up to 28 bytes. Often used for allocation in simple payments.
info.id: Numeric ID (uint64). Many exchanges use Memo ID for the allocation of deposits.
info.hash: 32-byte SHA-256 hash (as a 64-character hex string). Used by services for references.
info.return: 32-byte hash for returns. Used for returns (MEMO_RETURN).

createAccount.muxedInfo: The Muxed-ID creates an M-address (M...). It points to the same account as the regular address (G...).
createAccount.muxedIdInvalid: The Muxed ID must be an integer between 0 and 18,446,744,073,709,551,615.
createAccount.muxedActivationInfo: Muxed addresses are alias addresses. They do not need to be activated separately.

seo.title: Create/manage Muxed account
seo.description: Create and manage Muxed Address Aliases (M...) for a Stellar account. Generate IDs, add labels/notes, export/import CSV.

muxed.title: Create/Manage a Muxed Account
muxed.explainer: Generate alias addresses (M...) with a unique muxed ID for an existing account. The alias address always points to the same account.
muxed.infoButtonLabel: I am trained on data up to October 2023.

info.title: What is a Muxed account?
info.intro1: A muxed account combines a regular account address (G-address) with an additional 64-bit muxed ID.
info.intro2: Technically, it is an alias that always points to the same base account, but it can be uniquely identified by the ID.
info.purposeText: Muxed accounts are used to manage multiple sub-accounts under a single Stellar address—ideal when numerous deposits and withdrawals pass through a shared main account but each transaction needs to be allocated to a person, department, or project.
info.examplesTitle: Examples – what are muxed accounts useful for?

examples.ex1: Company Payments: Each employee receives their own Muxed-ID to ensure that salary payments can be accurately assigned.
examples.ex2: Exchanges or platforms: Each user receives their own Muxed ID so that deposits through a shared wallet are automatically recorded correctly.
examples.ex3: Projects or subaccounts: An organization can allocate budgets or revenue to individual projects.
examples.ex4: Customer Assignment: One M-address per customer; the ID corresponds to the customer ID - payments can be uniquely assigned, even without a memo.
examples.ex5: Services without memo: Differentiate deposits when the service doesn't support memos.
examples.ex6: Payouts/Payroll Runs: One M-address per employee/partner for internal accounting and reports.
examples.ex7: Shop/Orders: One shipping address per order; refunds can be associated with the order.
examples.ex8: Departments/Cost Centers: IDs as cost centers; automatically group payments by area.
examples.ex9: Multi-tenant services: Each tenant receives its own M-address under the same base account.

info.pageTitle: What this page does in the SKM
info.pageDesc: This page is used to manage the muxed accounts of your currently selected Stellar account:

createItems.i1: Create new Muxed addresses (M...) from your base address (G...).
createItems.i2: Optional with label (name) and note (e.g., project or purpose).

importItems.i1: Mass creation of Muxed accounts, e.g., from an employee list.

exportItems.i1: Export all saved entries as a CSV.
exportItems.i2: Fields: basePublicKey, muxedId, muxedAddress, label, note, createdAt.

templateItems.i1: Create an empty CSV file with the column headers muxedId, label, note.
templateItems.i2: Useful for HR or accounting departments for preparing new entries.

manageItems.i1: All stored muxed addresses are displayed in a table.
manageItems.i2: Selection, deletion, and management of labels/notes directly possible.

info.shortText: Muxed accounts make your Stellar account granular and bookable—ideal for organizations that process many payments through a central account but still want to uniquely track each transaction.

muxed.baseAccountInfo: This account remains technically the owner. The Muxed address (M...) merely points to this account.
muxed.countInfo: Number of new muxed addresses, sequential IDs.
muxed.tooMany: Please create no more than 100 at a time.
muxed.rangeOverflow: The ID range exceeds the maximum allowed Muxed ID.
muxed.label: Designation

import.hint: Import supports CSV with a header. Delimiters such as comma, semicolon, and tab are automatically detected. Unknown columns are ignored. Formats: extended (network, basePublicKey, muxedId, label, note, createdAt) or Template (muxedId, label, note).

error.invalidBaseAccount: The selected base address is invalid.
error.unknown: Unknown error in muxed address generation.
